definition: lit. to pour cold water on/fig. to dampen one's enthusiasm
to splash/to spill/rough and coarse/brutish
surname Leng
cold
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: Such moves have a chilling effect, the Asia Society report says.
sentences.chinese: 此类举动有泼冷水效应，亚洲协会的报告称。

sentences.english: But your wife" throws cold water" on the idea because she says a new car costs too much.
sentences.chinese: 但是你老婆朝你泼冷水，因为她觉得新车花太多钱了。

sentences.english: So this throws a bit of cold water on that.
sentences.chinese: 所以这一数据就像是朝这些乐观因素上大泼冷水。

definition: to pour cold water/fig. to discourage
(theater) to dismantle the stage/(fig.) to pull the rug out from under sb's feet/to undermine sb's plans
to inflate/to pump up/fig. to encourage/to boost morale
to praise sb in a way that puts them at a disadvantage
to pour oil on the fire (idiom); fig. to aggravate a situation/to enrage people and make matters worse
to flatter/to laud sb's accomplishments/adulation
to tag sb with unfair label/power word
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to express a different view/to take a different position
(coll.) to be the object of flattery/to be placed on a pedestal
(coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to whine/to be grouchy
to praise to the skies
to give orders/to spread news or rumors/to leak certain information intentionally
to be foolish/to play dumb/to gaze absentmindedly
